## utils namespace

## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [checkRequiredProperty(options)](./crypto.utils.checkrequiredproperty.md) | Checks whether the properties object provided contains the specified property. |
|  [checkValidProperty(options)](./crypto.utils.checkvalidproperty.md) | Checks whether the property specified is a member of the list of valid properties. |
|  [isBytesKeyPair(key)](./crypto.utils.isbyteskeypair.md) | Type guard function to check if the given key is a raw key pair of Uint8Array typed arrays. |
|  [isCryptoKeyPair(key)](./crypto.utils.iscryptokeypair.md) | Type guard function to check if the given key is a Web5Crypto.CryptoKeyPair. |
|  [keyToMultibaseId(options)](./crypto.utils.keytomultibaseid.md) |  |
|  [multibaseIdToKey(options)](./crypto.utils.multibaseidtokey.md) |  |
|  [randomBytes(bytesLength)](./crypto.utils.randombytes.md) | <p>Generates secure pseudorandom values of the specified length using <code>crypto.getRandomValues</code>, which defers to the operating system.</p><p>This function is a wrapper around <code>randomBytes</code> from the '<!-- -->@<!-- -->noble/hashes' package. It's designed to be cryptographically strong, suitable for generating keys, initialization vectors, and other random values.</p> |
|  [randomUuid()](./crypto.utils.randomuuid.md) | <p>Generates a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) using a cryptographically strong random number generator following the version 4 format, as specified in RFC 4122.</p><p>A version 4 UUID is a randomly generated UUID. The 13th character is set to '4' to denote version 4, and the 17th character is one of '8', '9', 'A', or 'B' to comply with the variant 1 format of UUIDs (the high bits are set to '10').</p><p>The UUID is a 36 character string, including hyphens, and looks like this: xxxxxxxx-xxxx-4xxx-axxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx</p><p>Note that while UUIDs are not guaranteed to be unique, they are practically unique" given the large number of possible UUIDs and the randomness of generation.</p><p>After generating the UUID, the function securely wipes the memory areas used to hold temporary values to prevent any possibility of the random values being unintentionally leaked or retained in memory.</p> |
